 8112: ms_excessive_nesting(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8113:     MkMSCond = fun (_Fun, N) when N < 0 -> true;
 8114:                    (Fun, N) -> {'orelse', {'==', N, '$1'}, Fun(Fun, N-1)}
 8115:                end,
 8116:     %% Ensure it compiles with substantial but reasonable
 8117:     %% (hmm...) nesting
 8118:     MS = [{{'$1', '$2'}, [MkMSCond(MkMSCond, 100)], [{{'$1', blipp}}]}],
 8119:     io:format("~p~n", [erlang:match_spec_test({1, blupp}, MS, table)]),
 8120:     _ = ets:match_spec_compile(MS),
 8121:     %% Now test match_spec_compile() and select_replace()
 8122:     %% with tree and hash using excessive nesting. These
 8123:     %% used to seg-fault the emulator due to recursion
 8124:     %% beyond the end of the C-stack.
 8125:     %%
 8126:     %% We expect to get a system_limit error, but don't
 8127:     %% fail if it compiles (someone must have rewritten
 8128:     %% compilation of match specs to use an explicit
 8129:     %% stack instead of using recursion).
 8130:     ENMS = [{{'$1', '$2'}, [MkMSCond(MkMSCond, 1000000)], [{{'$1', blipp}}]}],
 8131:     io:format("~p~n", [erlang:match_spec_test({1, blupp}, ENMS, table)]),
 8132:     ENMSC = try
 8133:                 ets:match_spec_compile(ENMS),
 8134:                 "compiled"
 8135:             catch
 8136:                 error:system_limit ->
 8137:                     "got system_limit"
 8138:             end,
 8139:     Tree = ets:new(tree, [ordered_set]),
 8140:     SRT = try
 8141:               ets:select_replace(Tree, ENMS),
 8142:               "compiled"
 8143:           catch
 8144:               error:system_limit ->
 8145:                   "got system_limit"
 8146:           end,
 8147:     Hash = ets:new(hash, [set]),
 8148:     SRH = try
 8149:               ets:select_replace(Hash, ENMS),
 8150:               "compiled"
 8151:           catch
 8152:               error:system_limit ->
 8153:                   "got system_limit"
 8154:           end,
 8155:     {comment, "match_spec_compile() "++ENMSC++"; select_replace(_,[ordered_set]) "++SRT++"; select_replace(_,[set]) "++SRH}.
 8156: 
 8157: %% The following help functions are used by
 8158: %% throughput_benchmark. They are declared on the top level beacuse
 8159: %% declaring them as function local funs cause a scalability issue.
 8160: get_op([{_,O}], _RandNum) ->
 8161:     O;
 8162: get_op([{Prob,O}|Rest], RandNum) ->
 8163:     case RandNum < Prob of
 8164:         true -> O;
 8165:         false -> get_op(Rest, RandNum)
 8166:     end.
 8167: do_op(Table, ProbHelpTab, Range, Operations) ->
 8168:     RandNum = rand:uniform(),
 8169:     Op = get_op(ProbHelpTab, RandNum),
 8170:     #{ Op := TheOp} = Operations,
 8171:     TheOp(Table, Range).
 8172: do_work(WorksDoneSoFar, Table, ProbHelpTab, Range, Operations) ->
 8173:     receive
 8174:         stop -> WorksDoneSoFar
 8175:     after
 8176:         0 -> do_op(Table, ProbHelpTab, Range, Operations),
 8177:              do_work(WorksDoneSoFar + 1, Table, ProbHelpTab, Range, Operations)
 8178:     end.
 8179: 
 8180: prefill_table(T, KeyRange, Num, ObjFun) ->
 8181:     Parent = self(),
 8182:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 8183:                        prefill_table_helper(T, KeyRange, Num, ObjFun),
 8184:                        Parent ! done
 8185:                end),
 8186:     receive done -> ok end.
 8187: 
 8188: prefill_table_helper(T, KeyRange, Num, ObjFun) ->
 8189:     Seed = rand:uniform(KeyRange),
 8190:     %%io:format("prefill_table: Seed = ~p\n", [Seed]),
 8191:     RState = unique_rand_start(KeyRange, Seed),
 8192:     prefill_table_loop(T, RState, Num, ObjFun).
 8193: 
 8194: prefill_table_loop(_, _, 0, _) ->
 8195:     ok;
 8196: prefill_table_loop(T, RS0, N, ObjFun) ->
 8197:     {Key, RS1} = unique_rand_next(RS0),
 8198:     ets:insert(T, ObjFun(Key)),
 8199:     prefill_table_loop(T, RS1, N-1, ObjFun).
 8200: 
 8201: inserter_proc_starter(T, ToInsert, Parent) ->
 8202:     receive
 8203:         start -> ok
 8204:     end,
 8205:     inserter_proc(T, ToInsert, [], Parent, false).
 8206: 
 8207: inserter_proc(T, [], Inserted, Parent, _) ->
 8208:     inserter_proc(T, Inserted, [], Parent, true);
 8209: inserter_proc(T, [I | ToInsert], Inserted, Parent, CanStop) ->
 8210:     Stop =
 8211:         case CanStop of
 8212:             true ->
 8213:                 receive
 8214:                     stop -> Parent ! stopped
 8215:                 after 0 -> no_stop
 8216:                 end;
 8217:             false -> no_stop
 8218:         end,
 8219:     case Stop of
 8220:         no_stop ->
 8221:             ets:insert(T, I),
 8222:             inserter_proc(T, ToInsert, [I | Inserted], Parent, CanStop);
 8223:         _ -> ok
 8224:     end.
 8225: 
 8226: prefill_table_parallel(T, KeyRange, Num, ObjFun) ->
 8227:     Parent = self(),
 8228:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 8229:                        prefill_table_parallel_helper(T, KeyRange, Num, ObjFun),
 8230:                        Parent ! done
 8231:                end),
 8232:     receive done -> ok end.
 8233: 
 8234: prefill_table_parallel_helper(T, KeyRange, Num, ObjFun) ->
 8235:     NrOfSchedulers = erlang:system_info(schedulers),
 8236:     Seed = rand:uniform(KeyRange),
 8237:     %%io:format("prefill_table: Seed = ~p\n", [Seed]),
 8238:     RState = unique_rand_start(KeyRange, Seed),
 8239:     InsertMap = prefill_insert_map_loop(T, RState, Num, ObjFun, #{}, NrOfSchedulers),
 8240:     Self = self(),
 8241:     Pids = [
 8242:         begin
 8243:             InserterFun =
 8244:                 fun() ->
 8245:                     inserter_proc_starter(T, ToInsert, Self)
 8246:                 end,
 8247:             spawn_link(InserterFun)
 8248:         end
 8249:         || ToInsert <- maps:values(InsertMap)],
 8250:     [Pid ! start || Pid <- Pids],
 8251:     timer:sleep(1000),
 8252:     [Pid ! stop || Pid <- Pids],
 8253:     [receive stopped -> ok end || _Pid <- Pids].
 8254: 
 8255: prefill_insert_map_loop(_, _, 0, _, InsertMap, _NrOfSchedulers) ->
 8256:     InsertMap;
 8257: prefill_insert_map_loop(T, RS0, N, ObjFun, InsertMap, NrOfSchedulers) ->
 8258:     {Key, RS1} = unique_rand_next(RS0),
 8259:     Sched = N rem NrOfSchedulers,
 8260:     PrevInserts = maps:get(Sched, InsertMap, []),
 8261:     NewPrevInserts = [ObjFun(Key) | PrevInserts],
 8262:     NewInsertMap = maps:put(Sched, NewPrevInserts, InsertMap),
 8263:     prefill_insert_map_loop(T, RS1, N-1, ObjFun, NewInsertMap, NrOfSchedulers).
 8264: 
 8265: -record(ets_throughput_bench_config,
 8266:         {benchmark_duration_ms = 3000,
 8267:          recover_time_ms = 1000,
 8268:          thread_counts = not_set,
 8269:          key_ranges = [1000000],
 8270:          init_functions = [fun prefill_table/4],
 8271:          nr_of_repeats = 1,
 8272:          scenarios =
 8273:              [
 8274:               [
 8275:                {0.5, insert},
 8276:                {0.5, delete}
 8277:               ],
 8278:               [
 8279:                {0.1, insert},
 8280:                {0.1, delete},
 8281:                {0.8, lookup}
 8282:               ],
 8283:               [
 8284:                {0.01, insert},
 8285:                {0.01, delete},
 8286:                {0.98, lookup}
 8287:               ],
 8288:               [
 8289:                {1.0, lookup}
 8290:               ],
 8291:               [
 8292:                {0.1, insert},
 8293:                {0.1, delete},
 8294:                {0.4, lookup},
 8295:                {0.4, nextseq10}
 8296:               ],
 8297:               [
 8298:                {0.1, insert},
 8299:                {0.1, delete},
 8300:                {0.4, lookup},
 8301:                {0.4, nextseq100}
 8302:               ],
 8303:               [
 8304:                {0.1, insert},
 8305:                {0.1, delete},
 8306:                {0.4, lookup},
 8307:                {0.4, nextseq1000}
 8308:               ],
 8309:               [
 8310:                {1.0, nextseq1000}
 8311:               ],
 8312:               [
 8313:                {0.1, insert},
 8314:                {0.1, delete},
 8315:                {0.79, lookup},
 8316:                {0.01, selectAll}
 8317:               ],
 8318:               [
 8319:                {0.1, insert},
 8320:                {0.1, delete},
 8321:                {0.7999, lookup},
 8322:                {0.0001, selectAll}
 8323:               ],
 8324:               [
 8325:                {0.1, insert},
 8326:                {0.1, delete},
 8327:                {0.799999, lookup},
 8328:                {0.000001, selectAll}
 8329:               ],
 8330:               [
 8331:                {0.1, insert},
 8332:                {0.1, delete},
 8333:                {0.79, lookup},
 8334:                {0.01, partial_select1000}
 8335:               ],
 8336:               [
 8337:                {0.1, insert},
 8338:                {0.1, delete},
 8339:                {0.7999, lookup},
 8340:                {0.0001, partial_select1000}
 8341:               ],
 8342:               [
 8343:                {0.1, insert},
 8344:                {0.1, delete},
 8345:                {0.799999, lookup},
 8346:                {0.000001, partial_select1000}
 8347:               ]
 8348:              ],
 8349:          table_types =
 8350:              [
 8351:               [ordered_set, public],
 8352:               [ordered_set, public, {write_concurrency, true}],
 8353:               [ordered_set, public, {read_concurrency, true}],
 8354:               [ordered_set, public, {write_concurrency, true}, {read_concurrency, true}],
 8355:               [set, public],
 8356:               [set, public, {write_concurrency, true}],
 8357:               [set, public, {read_concurrency, true}],
 8358:               [set, public, {write_concurrency, true}, {read_concurrency, true}],
 8359:               [set, public, {write_concurrency, auto}, {read_concurrency, true}],
 8360:               [set, public, {write_concurrency, {debug_hash_fixed_number_of_locks, 16384}}]
 8361:              ],
 8362:          etsmem_fun = fun() -> ok end,
 8363:          verify_etsmem_fun = fun(_) -> true end,
 8364:          notify_res_fun = fun(_Name, _Throughput) -> ok end,
 8365:          print_result_paths_fun =
 8366:              fun(ResultPath, _LatestResultPath) ->
 8367:                      Comment =
 8368:                          io_lib:format("<a href=\"file:///~s\">Result visualization</a>",[ResultPath]),
 8369:                      {comment, Comment}
 8370:              end
 8371:        }).
 8372: 
 8373: stdout_notify_res(ResultPath, LatestResultPath) ->
 8374:     io:format("Result Location: /~s~n", [ResultPath]),
 8375:     io:format("Latest Result Location: ~s~n", [LatestResultPath]).
 8376: 
 8377: throughput_benchmark() ->
 8378:     throughput_benchmark(
 8379:       #ets_throughput_bench_config{
 8380:          print_result_paths_fun = fun stdout_notify_res/2}).
 8381: 
 8382: throughput_benchmark(
 8383:   #ets_throughput_bench_config{
 8384:      benchmark_duration_ms  = BenchmarkDurationMs,
 8385:      recover_time_ms        = RecoverTimeMs,
 8386:      thread_counts          = ThreadCountsOpt,
 8387:      key_ranges             = KeyRanges,
 8388:      init_functions         = InitFuns,
 8389:      nr_of_repeats          = NrOfRepeats,
 8390:      scenarios              = Scenarios,
 8391:      table_types            = TableTypes,
 8392:      etsmem_fun             = ETSMemFun,
 8393:      verify_etsmem_fun      = VerifyETSMemFun,
 8394:      notify_res_fun         = NotifyResFun,
 8395:      print_result_paths_fun = PrintResultPathsFun}) ->
 8396:     NrOfSchedulers = erlang:system_info(schedulers),
 8397:     %% Definitions of operations that are supported by the benchmark
 8398:     NextSeqOp =
 8399:         fun (T, KeyRange, SeqSize) ->
 8400:                 Start = rand:uniform(KeyRange),
 8401:                 Last =
 8402:                     lists:foldl(
 8403:                       fun(_, Prev) ->
 8404:                               case Prev of
 8405:                                   '$end_of_table'-> ok;
 8406:                                   _ ->
 8407:                                       try ets:next(T, Prev) of
 8408:                                            Normal -> Normal
 8409:                                        catch
 8410:                                            error:badarg ->
 8411:                                                % sets (not ordered_sets) cannot handle when the argument
 8412:                                                % to next is not in the set
 8413:                                                rand:uniform(KeyRange)
 8414:                                        end
 8415:                               end
 8416:                       end,
 8417:                       Start,
 8418:                       lists:seq(1, SeqSize)),
 8419:                 case Last =:= -1 of
 8420:                     true -> io:format("Will never be printed");
 8421:                     false -> ok
 8422:                 end
 8423:         end,
 8424:     PartialSelectOp =
 8425:         fun (T, KeyRange, SeqSize) ->
 8426:                 Start = rand:uniform(KeyRange),
 8427:                 Last = Start + SeqSize,
 8428:                 case -1 =:= ets:select_count(T,
 8429:                                              ets:fun2ms(fun({X}) when X > Start andalso X =< Last  -> true end)) of
 8430:                     true -> io:format("Will never be printed");
 8431:                     false -> ok
 8432:                 end
 8433: 
 8434:         end,
 8435:     %% Mapping benchmark operation names to their corresponding functions that do them
 8436:     Operations =
 8437:         #{insert =>
 8438:               fun(T,KeyRange) ->
 8439:                       Num = rand:uniform(KeyRange),
 8440:                       ets:insert(T, {Num})
 8441:               end,
 8442:           delete =>
 8443:               fun(T,KeyRange) ->
 8444:                       Num = rand:uniform(KeyRange),
 8445:                       ets:delete(T, Num)
 8446:               end,
 8447:           lookup =>
 8448:               fun(T,KeyRange) ->
 8449:                       Num = rand:uniform(KeyRange),
 8450:                       ets:lookup(T, Num)
 8451:               end,
 8452:           nextseq10 =>
 8453:               fun(T,KeyRange) -> NextSeqOp(T,KeyRange,10) end,
 8454:           nextseq100 =>
 8455:               fun(T,KeyRange) -> NextSeqOp(T,KeyRange,100) end,
 8456:           nextseq1000 =>
 8457:               fun(T,KeyRange) -> NextSeqOp(T,KeyRange,1000) end,
 8458:           selectAll =>
 8459:               fun(T,_KeyRange) ->
 8460:                       case -1 =:= ets:select_count(T, ets:fun2ms(fun(_X) -> true end)) of
 8461:                           true -> io:format("Will never be printed");
 8462:                           false -> ok
 8463:                       end
 8464:               end,
 8465:           partial_select1000 =>
 8466:               fun(T,KeyRange) -> PartialSelectOp(T,KeyRange,1000) end
 8467:          },
 8468:     %% Helper functions
 8469:     CalculateThreadCounts = fun Calculate([Count|Rest]) ->
 8470:                                     case Count > NrOfSchedulers of
 8471:                                         true -> lists:reverse(Rest);
 8472:                                         false -> Calculate([Count*2,Count|Rest])
 8473:                                     end
 8474:                             end,
 8475:     CalculateOpsProbHelpTab =
 8476:         fun Calculate([{_, OpName}], _) ->
 8477:                 [{1.0, OpName}];
 8478:             Calculate([{OpPropability, OpName}|Res], Current) ->
 8479:                 NewCurrent = Current + OpPropability,
 8480:                 [{NewCurrent, OpName}| Calculate(Res, NewCurrent)]
 8481:         end,
 8482:     RenderScenario =
 8483:         fun R([], StringSoFar) ->
 8484:                 StringSoFar;
 8485:             R([{Fraction, Operation}], StringSoFar) ->
 8486:                 io_lib:format("~s ~f% ~p",[StringSoFar, Fraction * 100.0, Operation]);
 8487:             R([{Fraction, Operation}|Rest], StringSoFar) ->
 8488:                 R(Rest,
 8489:                   io_lib:format("~s ~f% ~p, ",[StringSoFar, Fraction * 100.0, Operation]))
 8490:         end,
 8491:     SafeFixTableIfRequired =
 8492:         fun(Table, Scenario, On) ->
 8493:                 case set =:= ets:info(Table, type) of
 8494:                     true ->
 8495:                         HasNotRequiringOp  =
 8496:                             lists:search(
 8497:                               fun({_,nextseq10}) -> true;
 8498:                                  ({_,nextseq100}) -> true;
 8499:                                  ({_,nextseq1000}) -> true;
 8500:                                  (_) -> false
 8501:                               end, Scenario),
 8502:                         case HasNotRequiringOp of
 8503:                             false -> ok;
 8504:                             _ -> ets:safe_fixtable(Table, On)
 8505:                         end;
 8506:                     false -> ok
 8507:                 end
 8508:         end,
 8509:     DataHolder =
 8510:         fun DataHolderFun(Data)->
 8511:                 receive
 8512:                     {get_data, Pid} -> Pid ! {ets_bench_data, Data};
 8513:                     D -> DataHolderFun([Data,D])
 8514:                 end
 8515:         end,
 8516:     DataHolderPid = spawn_link(fun()-> DataHolder([]) end),
 8517:     PrintData =
 8518:         fun (Str, List) ->
 8519:                 io:format(Str, List),
 8520:                 DataHolderPid ! io_lib:format(Str, List)
 8521:         end,
 8522:     GetData =
 8523:         fun () ->
 8524:                 DataHolderPid ! {get_data, self()},
 8525:                 receive {ets_bench_data, Data} -> Data end
 8526:         end,
 8527:     %% Function that runs a benchmark instance and returns the number
 8528:     %% of operations that were performed
 8529:     RunBenchmark =
 8530:         fun({NrOfProcs, TableConfig, Scenario, Range, Duration, InitFun}) ->
 8531:                 ProbHelpTab = CalculateOpsProbHelpTab(Scenario, 0),
 8532:                 Table = ets:new(t, TableConfig),
 8533:                 Nobj = Range div 2,
 8534:                 case InitFun of
 8535:                     not_set -> prefill_table(Table, Range, Nobj, fun(K) -> {K} end);
 8536:                     _ -> InitFun(Table, Range, Nobj, fun(K) -> {K} end)
 8537:                 end,
 8538:                 Nobj = ets:info(Table, size),
 8539:                 SafeFixTableIfRequired(Table, Scenario, true),
 8540:                 ParentPid = self(),
 8541:                 Worker =
 8542:                     fun() ->
 8543:                             receive start -> ok end,
 8544:                             WorksDone =
 8545:                                 do_work(0, Table, ProbHelpTab, Range, Operations),
 8546:                             ParentPid ! WorksDone
 8547:                     end,
 8548:                 ChildPids =
 8549:                     lists:map(fun(_N) ->spawn_link(Worker)end, lists:seq(1, NrOfProcs)),
 8550:                 erlang:garbage_collect(),
 8551:                 timer:sleep(RecoverTimeMs),
 8552:                 lists:foreach(fun(Pid) -> Pid ! start end, ChildPids),
 8553:                 timer:sleep(Duration),
 8554:                 lists:foreach(fun(Pid) -> Pid ! stop end, ChildPids),
 8555:                 TotalWorksDone = lists:foldl(
 8556:                                    fun(_, Sum) ->
 8557:                                            receive
 8558:                                                Count -> Sum + Count
 8559:                                            end
 8560:                                    end, 0, ChildPids),
 8561:                 SafeFixTableIfRequired(Table, Scenario, false),
 8562:                 ets:delete(Table),
 8563:                 TotalWorksDone
 8564:         end,
 8565:     RunBenchmarkInSepProcess =
 8566:         fun(ParameterTuple) ->
 8567:                 P = self(),
 8568:                 Results =
 8569:                     [begin
 8570:                          spawn_link(fun()-> P ! {bench_result, RunBenchmark(ParameterTuple)} end),
 8571:                          receive {bench_result, Res} -> Res end
 8572:                      end || _ <- lists:seq(1, NrOfRepeats)],
 8573:                 lists:sum(Results) / NrOfRepeats
 8574:         end,
 8575:     RunBenchmarkAndReport =
 8576:         fun(ThreadCount,
 8577:             TableType,
 8578:             Scenario,
 8579:             KeyRange,
 8580:             Duration,
 8581:             InitFunName,
 8582:             InitFun) ->
 8583:                 Result = RunBenchmarkInSepProcess({ThreadCount,
 8584:                                                    TableType,
 8585:                                                    Scenario,
 8586:                                                    KeyRange,
 8587:                                                    Duration,
 8588:                                                    InitFun}),
 8589:                 Throughput = Result/(Duration/1000.0),
 8590:                 PrintData("; ~f",[Throughput]),
 8591:                 Name = io_lib:format("Scenario: ~s, ~w, Key Range Size: ~w, "
 8592:                                      "# of Processes: ~w, Table Type: ~w",
 8593:                                      [InitFunName, Scenario, KeyRange, ThreadCount, TableType]),
 8594:                 NotifyResFun(Name, Throughput)
 8595:         end,
 8596:     ThreadCounts =
 8597:         case ThreadCountsOpt of
 8598:             not_set ->
 8599:                 CalculateThreadCounts([1]);
 8600:             _ -> ThreadCountsOpt
 8601:         end,
 8602:     %% Run the benchmark
 8603:     PrintData("# Each instance of the benchmark runs for ~w seconds:~n", [BenchmarkDurationMs/1000]),
 8604:     PrintData("# The result of a benchmark instance is presented as a number representing~n",[]),
 8605:     PrintData("# the number of operations performed per second:~n~n~n",[]),
 8606:     PrintData("# To plot graphs for the results below:~n",[]),
 8607:     PrintData("# 1. Open \"$ERL_TOP/lib/stdlib/test/ets_SUITE_data/visualize_throughput.html\" in a web browser~n",[]),
 8608:     PrintData("# 2. Copy the lines between \"#BENCHMARK STARTED$\" and \"#BENCHMARK ENDED$\" below~n",[]),
 8609:     PrintData("# 3. Paste the lines copied in step 2 to the text box in the browser window opened in~n",[]),
 8610:     PrintData("#    step 1 and press the Render button~n~n",[]),
 8611:     PrintData("#BENCHMARK STARTED$~n",[]),
 8612:     EtsMem = ETSMemFun(),
 8613:     %% The following loop runs all benchmark scenarios and prints the results (i.e, operations/second)
 8614:     lists:foreach(
 8615:       fun(KeyRange) ->
 8616:               lists:foreach(
 8617:                 fun(Scenario) ->
 8618:                         PrintData("Scenario: ~s | Key Range Size: ~w$~n",
 8619:                                   [RenderScenario(Scenario, ""), KeyRange]),
 8620:                         lists:foreach(
 8621:                           fun(ThreadCount) ->
 8622:                                   PrintData("; ~w",[ThreadCount])
 8623:                           end,
 8624:                           ThreadCounts),
 8625:                         PrintData("$~n",[]),
 8626:                         lists:foreach(
 8627:                           fun(TableType) ->
 8628:                                   lists:foreach(
 8629:                                     fun(InitFunArg) ->
 8630:                                             {InitFunName, InitFun} =
 8631:                                                 case InitFunArg of
 8632:                                                     {FunName, Fun} -> {FunName, Fun};
 8633:                                                     Fun -> {"", Fun}
 8634:                                                 end,
 8635:                                             PrintData("~s,~w ",[InitFunName,TableType]),
 8636:                                             lists:foreach(
 8637:                                               fun(ThreadCount) ->
 8638:                                                       RunBenchmarkAndReport(ThreadCount,
 8639:                                                                             TableType,
 8640:                                                                             Scenario,
 8641:                                                                             KeyRange,
 8642:                                                                             BenchmarkDurationMs,
 8643:                                                                             InitFunName,
 8644:                                                                             InitFun)
 8645:                                               end,
 8646:                                               ThreadCounts),
 8647:                                             PrintData("$~n",[])
 8648:                                     end,
 8649:                                     InitFuns)
 8650: 
 8651:                           end,
 8652:                           TableTypes)
 8653:                 end,
 8654:                 Scenarios)
 8655:       end,
 8656:       KeyRanges),
 8657:     PrintData("~n#BENCHMARK ENDED$~n~n",[]),
 8658:     VerifyETSMemFun(EtsMem),
 8659:     DataDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)), "ets_SUITE_data"),
 8660:     TemplatePath = filename:join(DataDir, "visualize_throughput.html"),
 8661:     {ok, Template} = file:read_file(TemplatePath),
 8662:     OutputData = string:replace(Template, "#bench_data_placeholder", GetData()),
 8663:     OutputPath1 = filename:join(DataDir, "ets_bench_result.html"),
 8664:     {{Year, Month, Day}, {Hour, Minute, Second}} = calendar:now_to_datetime(erlang:timestamp()),
 8665:     StrTime = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~4..0w-~2..0w-~2..0wT~2..0w:~2..0w:~2..0w",[Year,Month,Day,Hour,Minute,Second])),
 8666:     OutputPath2 = filename:join(DataDir, io_lib:format("ets_bench_result_~s.html", [StrTime])),
 8667:     file:write_file(OutputPath1, OutputData),
 8668:     file:write_file(OutputPath2, OutputData),
 8669:     PrintResultPathsFun(OutputPath2, OutputPath1).
 8670: 
 8671: test_throughput_benchmark(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8672:     throughput_benchmark(
 8673:       #ets_throughput_bench_config{
 8674:          benchmark_duration_ms = 100,
 8675:          recover_time_ms = 0,
 8676:          thread_counts = [1, erlang:system_info(schedulers)],
 8677:          key_ranges = [50000],
 8678:          etsmem_fun = fun etsmem/0,
 8679:          verify_etsmem_fun = fun verify_etsmem/1}).
 8680: 
 8681: long_throughput_benchmark(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8682:     N = erlang:system_info(schedulers),
 8683:     throughput_benchmark(
 8684:       #ets_throughput_bench_config{
 8685:          benchmark_duration_ms = 3000,
 8686:          recover_time_ms = 1000,
 8687:          thread_counts = [1, N div 2, N],
 8688:          key_ranges = [1000000],
 8689:          scenarios =
 8690:              [
 8691:               [
 8692:                {0.5, insert},
 8693:                {0.5, delete}
 8694:               ],
 8695:               [
 8696:                {0.1, insert},
 8697:                {0.1, delete},
 8698:                {0.8, lookup}
 8699:               ],
 8700:               [
 8701:                {0.01, insert},
 8702:                {0.01, delete},
 8703:                {0.98, lookup}
 8704:               ],
 8705:               [
 8706:                {0.1, insert},
 8707:                {0.1, delete},
 8708:                {0.4, lookup},
 8709:                {0.4, nextseq100}
 8710:               ],
 8711:               [
 8712:                {0.1, insert},
 8713:                {0.1, delete},
 8714:                {0.79, lookup},
 8715:                {0.01, selectAll}
 8716:               ],
 8717:               [
 8718:                {0.1, insert},
 8719:                {0.1, delete},
 8720:                {0.79, lookup},
 8721:                {0.01, partial_select1000}
 8722:               ]
 8723:              ],
 8724:          table_types =
 8725:              ([
 8726:                [ordered_set, public, {write_concurrency, true}, {read_concurrency, true}],
 8727:                [set, public, {write_concurrency, true}, {read_concurrency, true}]
 8728:               ] ++
 8729:                   case catch list_to_integer(erlang:system_info(otp_release)) of
 8730:                       Recent when is_integer(Recent), Recent >= 25 ->
 8731:                           [[set, public, {write_concurrency, auto}, {read_concurrency, true}]];
 8732:                       _Old -> []
 8733:                   end),
 8734:          etsmem_fun = fun etsmem/0,
 8735:          verify_etsmem_fun = fun verify_etsmem/1,
 8736:          notify_res_fun =
 8737:              fun(Name, Throughput) ->
 8738:                      SummaryTable =
 8739:                          proplists:get_value(ets_benchmark_result_summary_tab, Config),
 8740:                      AddToSummaryCounter =
 8741:                          case SummaryTable of
 8742:                              undefined ->
 8743:                                  fun(_, _) ->
 8744:                                          ok
 8745:                                  end;
 8746:                              Tab ->
 8747:                                  fun(CounterName, ToAdd) ->
 8748:                                          OldVal = ets:lookup_element(Tab, CounterName, 2),
 8749:                                          NewVal = OldVal + ToAdd,
 8750:                                          ets:insert(Tab, {CounterName, NewVal})
 8751:                                  end
 8752:                          end,
 8753:                      Record =
 8754:                          fun(NoOfBenchsCtr, TotThrputCtr) ->
 8755:                                  AddToSummaryCounter(NoOfBenchsCtr, 1),
 8756:                                  AddToSummaryCounter(TotThrputCtr, Throughput)
 8757:                          end,
 8758:                      Record(nr_of_benchmarks, total_throughput),
 8759:                      case string:find(Name, "ordered_set") of
 8760:                          nomatch ->
 8761:                              Record(nr_of_set_benchmarks, total_throughput_set);
 8762:                          _ ->
 8763:                              Record(nr_of_ordered_set_benchmarks,
 8764:                                     total_throughput_ordered_set)
 8765:                      end,
 8766:                      ct_event:notify(
 8767:                           #event{name = benchmark_data,
 8768:                                  data = [{suite,"ets_bench"},
 8769:                                          {name, Name},
 8770:                                          {value,Throughput}]})
 8771:              end
 8772:         }).
 8773: 
 8774: %% This function compares the lookup operation's performance for
 8775: %% ordered_set ETS tables with and without write_concurrency enabled
 8776: %% when the data structures have been populated in parallel and
 8777: %% sequentially.
 8778: %%
 8779: %% The main purpose of this function is to check that the
 8780: %% implementation of ordered_set with write_concurrency (CA tree)
 8781: %% adapts its structure to contention even when only lookup operations
 8782: %% are used.
 8783: lookup_catree_par_vs_seq_init_benchmark() ->
 8784:     N = erlang:system_info(schedulers),
 8785:     throughput_benchmark(
 8786:       #ets_throughput_bench_config{
 8787:          benchmark_duration_ms = 600000,
 8788:          recover_time_ms = 1000,
 8789:          thread_counts = [1, N div 2, N],
 8790:          key_ranges = [1000000],
 8791:          init_functions = [{"seq_init", fun prefill_table/4},
 8792:                            {"par_init", fun prefill_table_parallel/4}],
 8793:          nr_of_repeats = 1,
 8794:          scenarios =
 8795:              [
 8796:               [
 8797:                {1.0, lookup}
 8798:               ]
 8799:              ],
 8800:          table_types =
 8801:              [
 8802:               [ordered_set, public, {write_concurrency, true}],
 8803:               [ordered_set, public]
 8804:              ],
 8805:           print_result_paths_fun = fun stdout_notify_res/2
 8806:         }).
 8807: 
 8808: add_lists(L1,L2) ->
 8809:     add_lists(L1,L2,[]).
 8810: add_lists([],[],Acc) ->
 8811:     lists:reverse(Acc);
 8812: add_lists([E1|T1], [E2|T2], Acc) ->
 8813:     add_lists(T1, T2, [E1+E2 | Acc]).
 8814: 
 8815: run_smp_workers(InitF,ExecF,FiniF,Laps) ->
 8816:     run_smp_workers(InitF,ExecF,FiniF,Laps, 0).
 8817: run_smp_workers(InitF,ExecF,FiniF,Laps, Exclude) ->
 8818:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 8819:         N when N > Exclude ->
 8820:             run_workers_do(InitF,ExecF,FiniF,Laps, N - Exclude);
 8821:         _ ->
 8822:             {skipped, "Too few schedulers online"}
 8823:     end.
 8824: 
 8825: run_sched_workers(InitF,ExecF,FiniF,Laps) ->
 8826:     run_workers_do(InitF,ExecF,FiniF,Laps,
 8827:                    erlang:system_info(schedulers)).
 8828: 
 8829: run_workers_do(InitF,ExecF,FiniF,Laps, NumOfProcs) ->
 8830:     io:format("starting ~p workers\n",[NumOfProcs]),
 8831:     Seeds = [{ProcN,rand:uniform(9999)} || ProcN <- lists:seq(1,NumOfProcs)],
 8832:     Parent = self(),
 8833:     Pids = [my_spawn_link(fun()-> worker(Seed,InitF,ExecF,FiniF,Laps,Parent,NumOfProcs) end)
 8834: 	    || Seed <- Seeds],
 8835:     case Laps of
 8836: 	infinite -> Pids;
 8837: 	_ -> wait_pids(Pids)
 8838:     end.
 8839: 
 8840: worker({ProcN,Seed}, InitF, ExecF, FiniF, Laps, Parent, NumOfProcs) ->
 8841:     io:format("smp worker ~p, seed=~p~n",[self(),Seed]),
 8842:     rand:seed(default, {Seed,Seed,Seed}),
 8843:     State1 = InitF([ProcN, NumOfProcs]),
 8844:     State2 = worker_loop(Laps, ExecF, State1),
 8845:     Result = FiniF(State2),
 8846:     io:format("worker ~p done\n",[self()]),
 8847:     Parent ! {self(), Result}.
 8848: 
 8849: worker_loop(0, _, State) ->
 8850:     State;
 8851: worker_loop(_, _, [end_of_work|State]) ->
 8852:     State;
 8853: worker_loop(infinite, ExecF, State) ->
 8854:     worker_loop(infinite,ExecF,ExecF(State));
 8855: worker_loop(N, ExecF, State) ->
 8856:     worker_loop(N-1,ExecF,ExecF(State)).
 8857: 
 8858: wait_pids(Pids) ->
 8859:     wait_pids(Pids,[]).
 8860: wait_pids([],Acc) ->
 8861:     Acc;
 8862: wait_pids(Pids, Acc) ->
 8863:     receive
 8864: 	{Pid,Result} ->
 8865: 	    true = lists:member(Pid,Pids),
 8866: 	    Others = lists:delete(Pid,Pids),
 8867: 	    %%io:format("wait_pid got ~p from ~p\n",[Result,Pid]),
 8868: 	    wait_pids(Others,[Result | Acc])
 8869:     after 60*1000 ->
 8870: 	    io:format("Still waiting for workers ~p\n",[Pids]),
 8871:             wait_pids(Pids, Acc)
 8872:     end.
 8873: 
 8874:

 8877: my_tab_to_list(Ts) ->
 8878:     Key = ets:first(Ts),
 8879:     my_tab_to_list(Ts,ets:next(Ts,Key),[ets:lookup(Ts, Key)]).
 8880: 
 8881: my_tab_to_list(_Ts,'$end_of_table', Acc) -> lists:reverse(Acc);
 8882: my_tab_to_list(Ts,Key, Acc) ->
 8883:     my_tab_to_list(Ts,ets:next(Ts,Key),[ets:lookup(Ts, Key)| Acc]).

 8885: 
 8886: wait_for_memory_deallocations() ->
 8887:     try
 8888: 	erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, thread_progress),
 8889: 	erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, deallocations)
 8890:     catch
 8891: 	error:undef ->
 8892: 	    erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 8893: 	    wait_for_memory_deallocations();
 8894:         error:badarg ->
 8895:             %% The emulator we run on does not have the wait internal state
 8896:             %% so we just sleep some time instead...
 8897:             timer:sleep(100)
 8898:     end.
 8899: 
 8900: etsmem() ->
 8901:     etsmem(get_etsmem(), 1).
 8902: 
 8903: etsmem(PrevEtsMem, Try) when Try < 10 ->
 8904:     case get_etsmem() of
 8905:         PrevEtsMem ->
 8906:             PrevEtsMem;
 8907:         EtsMem ->
 8908:             io:format("etsmem(): Change in attempt ~p~n~nbefore:~n~p~n~nafter:~n~p~n~n",
 8909:                       [Try, PrevEtsMem, EtsMem]),
 8910:             etsmem(EtsMem, Try+1)
 8911:     end;
 8912: etsmem(_, _) ->
 8913:     ct:fail("Failed to get a stable/consistent memory snapshot").
 8914: 
 8915: get_etsmem() ->
 8916:     AllTabsExceptions = [logger, code],
 8917:     %% The logger table is excluded from the AllTabs list
 8918:     %% below because it uses decentralized counters to keep
 8919:     %% track of the size and the memory counters. This cause
 8920:     %% ets:info(T,size) and ets:info(T,memory) to trigger
 8921:     %% allocations and frees that may change the amount of
 8922:     %% memory that is allocated for ETS.
 8923:     %%
 8924:     %% The code table is excluded from the list below
 8925:     %% because the amount of memory allocated for it may
 8926:     %% change if the tested code loads a new module.
 8927:     AllTabs =
 8928:         lists:sort(
 8929:           [begin
 8930:                try ets:info(T, decentralized_counters) of
 8931:                    true ->
 8932:                        ct:fail("Background ETS table (~p) that "
 8933:                                "uses decentralized counters (Add exception?)",
 8934:                                [ets:info(T,name)]);
 8935:                    _ -> ok
 8936:                catch _:_ ->
 8937:                        ok
 8938:                end,
 8939:                {T,
 8940:                 ets:info(T,name),
 8941:                 ets:info(T,size),
 8942:                 ets:info(T,memory),
 8943:                 ets:info(T,type)}
 8944:            end
 8945:            || T <- ets:all(),
 8946:               not lists:member(ets:info(T, name), AllTabsExceptions)]),
 8947:     wait_for_memory_deallocations(),
 8948:     EtsAllocSize = erts_debug:alloc_blocks_size(ets_alloc),
 8949:     ErlangMemoryEts = try erlang:memory(ets)
 8950:                       catch error:notsup -> notsup end,
 8951:     FlxCtrMemUsage = try erts_debug:get_internal_state(flxctr_memory_usage)
 8952:                      catch error:badarg -> notsup end,
 8953:     Mem = {ErlangMemoryEts, EtsAllocSize, FlxCtrMemUsage},
 8954:     {Mem, AllTabs}.
 8955: 
 8956: verify_etsmem(MI) ->
 8957:     wait_for_test_procs(),
 8958:     verify_etsmem(MI, 1).
 8959: 
 8960: verify_etsmem({MemInfo,AllTabs}, Try) ->
 8961:     case etsmem() of
 8962: 	{MemInfo,_} ->
 8963: 	    io:format("Ets mem info: ~p", [MemInfo]),
 8964: 	    case {MemInfo, Try} of
 8965: 		{{ErlMem,EtsAlloc},_} when ErlMem == notsup; EtsAlloc == undefined ->
 8966: 		    %% Use 'erl +Mea max' to do more complete memory leak testing.
 8967: 		    {comment,"Incomplete or no mem leak testing"};
 8968: 		{_, 1} ->
 8969:                     ok;
 8970:                 _ ->
 8971:                     {comment, "Transient memory discrepancy"}
 8972: 	    end;
 8973: 
 8974: 	{MemInfo2, AllTabs2} ->
 8975: 	    io:format("#Expected: ~p", [MemInfo]),
 8976: 	    io:format("#Actual:   ~p", [MemInfo2]),
 8977: 	    io:format("#Changed tables before: ~p\n",[AllTabs -- AllTabs2]),
 8978: 	    io:format("#Changed tables after: ~p\n", [AllTabs2 -- AllTabs]),
 8979:             case Try < 2 of
 8980:                 true ->
 8981:                     io:format("\n#This discrepancy could be caused by an "
 8982:                               "inconsistent memory \"snapshot\""
 8983:                               "\n#Try again...\n", []),
 8984:                     verify_etsmem({MemInfo, AllTabs}, Try+1);
 8985:                 false ->
 8986:                     ct:fail("Failed memory check")
 8987:             end
 8988:     end.
 8989: 
 8990: 
 8991: start_loopers(N, Prio, Fun, State) ->
 8992:     lists:map(fun (_) ->
 8993: 		      my_spawn_opt(fun () -> looper(Fun, State) end,
 8994: 				   [{priority, Prio}, link])
 8995: 	      end,
 8996: 	      lists:seq(1, N)).
 8997: 
 8998: stop_loopers(Loopers) ->
 8999:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 9000: 			  unlink(P),
 9001: 			  exit(P, bang)
 9002: 		  end,
 9003: 		  Loopers),
 9004:     ok.
 9005: 
 9006: looper(Fun, State) ->
 9007:     looper(Fun, Fun(State)).
 9008: 
 9009: spawn_logger(Procs) ->
 9010:     receive
 9011: 	{new_test_proc, Proc} ->
 9012: 	    spawn_logger([Proc|Procs]);
 9013: 	{sync_test_procs, Kill, From} ->
 9014: 	    lists:foreach(fun (Proc) when From == Proc ->
 9015: 				  ok;
 9016: 			      (Proc) ->
 9017: 				  Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Proc),
 9018: 				  ok = receive
 9019: 				      {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} ->
 9020: 					  ok
 9021: 				  after 0 ->
 9022: 					  case Kill of
 9023: 					      true -> exit(Proc, kill);
 9024: 					      _ -> ok
 9025: 					  end,
 9026: 					  receive
 9027: 					      {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} ->
 9028: 						  ok
 9029:                                           after 5000 ->
 9030: 						  io:format("Waiting for 'DOWN' from ~w, status=~w\n"
 9031:                                                             "info = ~p\n", [Proc,
 9032:                                                                             pid_status(Proc),
 9033:                                                                             process_info(Proc)]),
 9034:                                                   timeout
 9035: 					  end
 9036: 				  end
 9037: 			  end, Procs),
 9038: 	    From ! test_procs_synced,
 9039: 	    spawn_logger([From])
 9040:     end.
 9041: 
 9042: pid_status(Pid) ->
 9043:     try
 9044: 	erts_debug:get_internal_state({process_status, Pid})
 9045:     catch
 9046: 	error:undef ->
 9047: 	    erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 9048: 	    pid_status(Pid)
 9049:     end. 
 9050: 
 9051: start_spawn_logger() ->
 9052:     case whereis(ets_test_spawn_logger) of
 9053: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) -> true;
 9054: 	_ -> register(ets_test_spawn_logger,
 9055: 		      spawn_opt(fun () -> spawn_logger([]) end,
 9056: 				[{priority, max}]))
 9057:     end.
 9058: 
 9059: %% restart_spawn_logger() ->
 9060: %%     stop_spawn_logger(),
 9061: %%     start_spawn_logger().
 9062: 
 9063: stop_spawn_logger() ->
 9064:     Mon = erlang:monitor(process, ets_test_spawn_logger),
 9065:     (catch exit(whereis(ets_test_spawn_logger), kill)),
 9066:     receive {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} -> ok end.
 9067: 
 9068: wait_for_test_procs() ->
 9069:     wait_for_test_procs(false).
 9070: 
 9071: wait_for_test_procs(Kill) ->
 9072:     ets_test_spawn_logger ! {sync_test_procs, Kill, self()},
 9073:     receive test_procs_synced -> ok end.
 9074: 
 9075: log_test_proc(Proc) when is_pid(Proc) ->
 9076:     ets_test_spawn_logger ! {new_test_proc, Proc},
 9077:     Proc.
 9078: 
 9079: my_spawn(Fun) -> log_test_proc(spawn(Fun)).
 9080: 
 9081: my_spawn_link(Fun) -> log_test_proc(spawn_link(Fun)).
 9082: 
 9083: my_spawn_opt(Fun,Opts) ->
 9084:     case spawn_opt(Fun,Opts) of
 9085: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) -> log_test_proc(Pid);
 9086: 	{Pid, _} = Res when is_pid(Pid) -> log_test_proc(Pid), Res
 9087:     end.
 9088: 
 9089: my_spawn_monitor(Fun) ->
 9090:     Res = spawn_monitor(Fun),
 9091:     {Pid, _} = Res,
 9092:     log_test_proc(Pid),
 9093:     Res.
 9094: 
 9095: repeat(_Fun, 0) ->
 9096:     ok;
 9097: repeat(Fun, N) ->
 9098:     Fun(),
 9099:     repeat(Fun, N-1).
 9100: 
 9101: repeat_while(Fun) ->
 9102:     case Fun() of
 9103: 	true -> repeat_while(Fun);
 9104: 	false -> false
 9105:     end.
 9106: 
 9107: repeat_while(Fun, Arg0) ->
 9108:     case Fun(Arg0) of
 9109: 	{true,Arg1} -> repeat_while(Fun,Arg1);
 9110: 	{false,Ret} -> Ret
 9111:     end.
 9112: 
 9113: %% Some (but not all) permutations of List
 9114: repeat_for_permutations(Fun, List) ->
 9115:     repeat_for_permutations(Fun, List, length(List)-1).
 9116: repeat_for_permutations(Fun, List, 0) ->
 9117:     Fun(List);
 9118: repeat_for_permutations(Fun, List, N) ->
 9119:     {A,B} = lists:split(N, List),
 9120:     L1 = B++A,
 9121:     L2 = lists:reverse(L1),
 9122:     L3 = B++lists:reverse(A),
 9123:     L4 = lists:reverse(B)++A,
 9124:     Fun(L1), Fun(L2), Fun(L3), Fun(L4),
 9125:     repeat_for_permutations(Fun, List, N-1).
 9126: 
 9127: receive_any() ->
 9128:     receive M ->
 9129: 	    %%io:format("Process ~p got msg ~p\n", [self(),M]),
 9130: 	    M
 9131:     end.
 9132: 
 9133: receive_any_spinning() ->
 9134:     receive_any_spinning(1000000).
 9135: receive_any_spinning(Loops) ->
 9136:     receive_any_spinning(Loops,Loops,1).
 9137: receive_any_spinning(Loops,0,Tries) ->
 9138:     receive M ->
 9139: 	    io:format("Spinning process ~p got msg ~p after ~p tries\n", [self(),M,Tries]),
 9140: 	    M
 9141:     after 0 ->
 9142: 	    receive_any_spinning(Loops, Loops, Tries+1)
 9143:     end;
 9144: receive_any_spinning(Loops, N, Tries) when N>0 ->
 9145:     receive_any_spinning(Loops, N-1, Tries).
 9146:

 9149: spawn_monitor_with_pid(Pid, Fun) when is_pid(Pid) ->
 9150:     spawn_monitor_with_pid(Pid, Fun, 10).
 9151: 
 9152: spawn_monitor_with_pid(_, _, 0) ->
 9153:     failed;
 9154: spawn_monitor_with_pid(Pid, Fun, N) ->
 9155:     case my_spawn(fun()-> case self() of
 9156: 			      Pid -> Fun();
 9157: 			      _ -> die
 9158: 			  end
 9159: 		  end) of
 9160: 	Pid ->
 9161: 	    {Pid, erlang:monitor(process, Pid)};
 9162: 	_Other ->
 9163: 	    spawn_monitor_with_pid(Pid,Fun,N-1)
 9164:     end.

 9167: only_if_smp(Func) ->
 9168:     only_if_smp(2, Func).
 9169: only_if_smp(Schedulers, Func) ->
 9170:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 9171: 	N when N < Schedulers -> {skip,"Too few schedulers online"};
 9172: 	_ -> Func()
 9173:     end.

 9417:                                                       {error_term,already_exists}]},

 9481: 
 9482:          {test_ms, 2},                          %Not BIF.
 9483:          {to_dets, 2},                          %Not BIF.
 9484: 
 9485:          {update_counter, ['$Tab', no_key, 1], [{error_term,badkey}]},
 9486:          {update_counter, ['$Tab', no_key, bad_increment], [{error_term,badkey}]},
 9487:          {update_counter, ['$Tab', no_key, {1, 42}], [{error_term,badkey}]},
 9488:          {update_counter, ['$Tab', no_key, {1, bad_increment}], [{error_term,badkey}]},
 9489: 
 9490:          {update_counter, [OneKeyTab, one, {2, 1}]},
 9491:          {update_counter, [OneKeyTab, one, {2, bad_increment}]},
 9492:          {update_counter, [OneKeyTab, one, {3, bad_increment}]},
 9493:          {update_counter, [OneKeyTab, one, {4, 1}], [{error_term,position}]},
 9494:          {update_counter, [OneKeyTab, one, {4, bad_increment}]},
 9495: 
 9496:          {update_counter, [BagTab, bag_key, 1], [{error_term,table_type}]},
 9497:          {update_counter, [BagTab, bag_key, bad_increment], [{error_term,table_type}]},
 9498: 
 9499:          {update_counter, ['$Tab', key, 2, {key,0}], [no_fail]},
 9500:          {update_counter, ['$Tab', key, {1,42}, {key,0}], [{error_term,keypos}]},
 9501:          {update_counter, ['$Tab', key, 2, {key,not_integer}]},
 9502:          {update_counter, ['$Tab', key, 3, {key,whatever}]},
 9503: 
 9504:          {update_counter, ['$Tab', no_key, 1, default]},
 9505:          {update_counter, ['$Tab', no_key, bad_increment, {tag,0}]},
 9506:          {update_counter, ['$Tab', no_key, {1, bad_increment}, {tag,0}]},
 9507:          {update_counter, ['$Tab', no_key, {1, 42}, {tag,0}], [{error_term,keypos}]},
 9508:          {update_counter, ['$Tab', no_key, {2, 42}, {tag,not_integer}]},
 9509:          {update_counter, ['$Tab', no_key, {3, 42}, {tag,not_integer}], [{error_term,position}]},
 9510: 
 9511:          {update_counter, [OneKeyTab, one, {2, 1}, {tag,val}]},
 9512:          {update_counter, [OneKeyTab, one, {2, bad_increment}, {tag,val}]},
 9513:          {update_counter, [OneKeyTab, one, {3, bad_increment}, {tag,val}]},
 9514:          {update_counter, [OneKeyTab, one, {4, 1}, {tag,val}], [{error_term,position}]},
 9515:          {update_counter, [OneKeyTab, one, {4, bad_increment}, {tag,val}]},
 9516: 
 9517:          {update_element, ['$Tab', no_key, {2, new}], [no_fail]},
 9518:          {update_element, [BagTab, no_key, {2, bagged}]},
 9519:          {update_element, [OneKeyTab, one, not_tuple]},
 9520:          {update_element, [OneKeyTab, one, {0, new}]},
 9521:          {update_element, [OneKeyTab, one, {1, new}], [{error_term,keypos}]},
 9522:          {update_element, [OneKeyTab, one, {4, new}]},
 9523: 
 9524:          {whereis, [{bad,name}], [no_table]}
 9525:         ],
 9526:     put(errors, []),
 9527:     eval_ets_bif_errors(L),
 9528:     io:nl(),
 9529:     case lists:sort(get(errors)) of
 9530:         [] ->
 9531:             ok;
 9532:         [_|_]=Errors ->
 9533:             io:format("~P\n", [Errors, 100]),
 9534:             ct:fail({length(Errors),errors})
 9535:     end.
 9536: 
 9537: eval_ets_bif_errors(L0) ->
 9538:     L1 = lists:foldl(fun({_,A}, Acc) when is_integer(A) -> Acc;
 9539:                         ({F,A}, Acc) -> [{F,A,[]}|Acc];
 9540:                         ({F,A,Opts}, Acc) -> [{F,A,Opts}|Acc]
 9541:                      end, [], L0),
 9542:     Tests = ordsets:from_list([{F,length(A)} || {F,A,_} <- L1] ++
 9543:                                   [{F,A} || {F,A} <- L0, is_integer(A)]),
 9544:     Bifs0 = [{F,A} || {F,A} <- ets:module_info(exports),
 9545:                       A =/= 0,
 9546:                       F =/= module_info],
 9547:     Bifs = ordsets:from_list(Bifs0),
 9548:     NYI = [{F,lists:duplicate(A, '*'),nyi} || {F,A} <- Bifs -- Tests],
 9549:     L = lists:sort(NYI ++ L1),
 9550: 
 9551:     spawn(fun() ->
 9552:                   true = register(living, self()),
 9553:                   Ref = make_ref(),
 9554:                   receive
 9555:                       Ref ->
 9556:                           ok
 9557:                   end
 9558:           end),
 9559: 
 9560:     do_eval_ets_bif_errors(L).
 9561: 
 9562: do_eval_ets_bif_errors([H|T]) ->
 9563:     case H of
 9564:         {F, Args} ->
 9565:             eval_ets_bif_errors(F, Args, []);
 9566:         {_, Args, nyi} ->
 9567:             case lists:all(fun(A) -> A =:= '*' end, Args) of
 9568:                 true ->
 9569:                     store_error(nyi, H, error);
 9570:                 false ->
 9571:                     store_error(bad_nyi, H, error)
 9572:             end;
 9573:         {F, Args, Opts} when is_list(Opts) ->
 9574:             case lists:member(no_table, Opts) of
 9575:                 true ->
 9576:                     ets_eval_bif_errors_once(F, Args, Opts);
 9577:                 false ->
 9578:                     eval_ets_bif_errors(F, Args, Opts)
 9579:             end
 9580:     end,
 9581:     do_eval_ets_bif_errors(T);
 9582: do_eval_ets_bif_errors([]) ->
 9583:     ok.
 9584: 
 9585: ets_eval_bif_errors_once(F, Args, Opts) ->
 9586:     MFA = {ets,F,Args},
 9587:     io:format("\n\n*** ets:~p/~p", [F,length(Args)]),
 9588: 
 9589:     NoFail = lists:member(no_fail, Opts),
 9590:     ErrorTerm = proplists:get_value(error_term, Opts, none),
 9591:     case ets_apply(F, Args, Opts) of
 9592:         {error,ErrorTerm} when not NoFail ->
 9593:             ok;
 9594:         {error,Info} ->
 9595:             store_error(wrong_failure_reason, MFA, Info);
 9596:         ok when NoFail ->
 9597:             ok;
 9598:         ok when not NoFail ->
 9599:             %% This ETS function was supposed to fail.
 9600:             store_error(expected_failure, MFA, ok)
 9601:     end.
 9602: 
 9603: eval_ets_bif_errors(F, Args0, Opts) ->
 9604:     MFA = {ets,F,Args0},
 9605:     io:format("\n\n*** ets:~p/~p", [F,length(Args0)]),
 9606: 
 9607:     %% Test the ETS function with a valid table argument.
 9608:     %% Test both for sets and ordered sets.
 9609:     _ = eval_ets_valid_tid(F, Args0, Opts, set),
 9610:     Args = eval_ets_valid_tid(F, Args0, Opts, ordered_set),
 9611: 
 9612:     %% Replace the table id with a plain ref to provoke a type error.
 9613:     BadArgs = eval_expand_bad_args(Args),
 9614:     case ets_apply(F, BadArgs, Opts) of
 9615:         {error,type} ->
 9616:             ok;
 9617:         BadIdResult ->
 9618:             store_error(bad_table_id, MFA, BadIdResult)
 9619:     end.
 9620: 
 9621: eval_ets_valid_tid(F, Args0, Opts, Type) ->
 9622:     MFA = {ets,F,Args0},
 9623:     Args = eval_expand_args(Args0, Type),
 9624:     case should_apply(Args, Opts) of
 9625:         false ->
 9626:             %% Applying this function will never fail.
 9627:             ok;
 9628:         true ->
 9629:             NoFail = lists:member(no_fail, Opts),
 9630:             ErrorTerm = proplists:get_value(error_term, Opts, none),
 9631:             case ets_apply(F, Args, Opts) of
 9632:                 {error,ErrorTerm} when not NoFail ->
 9633:                     ok;
 9634:                 {error,Info} when not NoFail ->
 9635:                     store_error(wrong_failure_reason, MFA, Info);
 9636:                 {error,Info} when NoFail ->
 9637:                     store_error(expected_success, MFA, Info);
 9638:                 ok when NoFail ->
 9639:                     ok;
 9640:                 ok when not NoFail ->
 9641:                     %% This ETS function was supposed to fail.
 9642:                     store_error(expected_failure, MFA, ok)
 9643:             end
 9644:     end,
 9645: 
 9646:     %% Test the ETS function from another process to provoke an error
 9647:     %% because of missing access rights. (The table is private.)
 9648:     {Pid,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> exit(ets_apply(F, Args, Opts)) end),
 9649:     receive
 9650:         {'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,Result} ->
 9651:             case Result of
 9652:                 {error,access} ->
 9653:                     ok;
 9654:                 {error,not_owner} when F =:= give_away ->
 9655:                     ok;
 9656:                 {error,none} when F =:= info ->
 9657:                     ok;
 9658:                 ok when F =:= info ->
 9659:                     ok;
 9660:                 Other ->
 9661:                     store_error(access, MFA, Other)
 9662:             end
 9663:     end,
 9664: 
 9665:     %% Delete the ETS table.
 9666:     eval_delete_tab(Args),
 9667:     case ets_apply(F, Args, Opts) of
 9668:         {error,id} ->
 9669:             ok;
 9670:         ok when F =:= info ->
 9671:             %% ets:info/1,2 returns `undefined` instead of failing if the
 9672:             %% table has been deleted.
 9673:             ok;
 9674:         DeadTableResult ->
 9675:             store_error(dead_table, MFA, DeadTableResult)
 9676:     end,
 9677: 
 9678:     Args.
 9679: 
 9680: should_apply([_], _Opts) ->
 9681:     %% An ETS function with a single argument can't fail if
 9682:     %% the argument is valid.
 9683:     false;
 9684: should_apply([_,_|_], Opts) ->
 9685:     %% Applying the function on a valid table would have side effects
 9686:     %% that would cause problems down the line (e.g. successfully
 9687:     %% giving away a table).
 9688:     not lists:member(only_bad_table, Opts).
 9689: 
 9690: store_error(What, MFA, Wrong) ->
 9691:     put(errors, [{What,MFA,Wrong}|get(errors)]).
 9692: 
 9693: eval_expand_args(Args, Type) ->
 9694:     [expand_arg(A, Type) || A <- Args].
 9695: 
 9696: expand_arg('$Tab', Type) -> ets:new(table, [Type, private]);
 9697: expand_arg('$Self', _Type) -> self();
 9698: expand_arg('$Living', _Type) -> whereis(living);
 9699: expand_arg('$Dead', _Type) ->
 9700:     {Pid,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> ok end),
 9701:     receive
 9702:         {'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,normal} -> Pid
 9703:     end;
 9704: expand_arg(Fun, Type) when is_function(Fun, 1) -> Fun(Type);
 9705: expand_arg(Arg, _Type) -> Arg.
 9706: 
 9707: eval_delete_tab(['$named_table'=H|_]) ->
 9708:     ets:delete(H);
 9709: eval_delete_tab([H|_]) when is_reference(H) ->
 9710:     ets:delete(H);
 9711: eval_delete_tab([_|T]) ->
 9712:     eval_delete_tab(T).
 9713: 
 9714: eval_expand_bad_args(['$named_table'|T]) ->
 9715:     [make_ref()|T];
 9716: eval_expand_bad_args([H|T]) when is_reference(H) ->
 9717:     [make_ref()|T];
 9718: eval_expand_bad_args([H|T]) ->
 9719:     [H|eval_expand_bad_args(T)].
 9720: 
 9721: ets_apply(F, Args, Opts) ->
 9722:     try
 9723:         apply(ets, F, Args),
 9724:         io:format("\nets:~p(~s) succeeded", [F,ets_format_args(Args)])
 9725:     catch
 9726:         C:R:Stk ->
 9727:             SF = fun(Mod, _, _) -> Mod =:= test_server end,
 9728:             Str = erl_error:format_exception(C, R, Stk, #{stack_trim_fun => SF}),
 9729:             BinStr = iolist_to_binary(Str),
 9730:             io:format("\nets:~p(~s)\n~ts", [F,ets_format_args(Args),BinStr]),
 9731: 
 9732:             {ets,ActualF,ActualArgs,Info} = hd(Stk),
 9733: 
 9734:             RE = <<"[*][*][*] argument \\d+:">>,
 9735:             case re:run(BinStr, RE, [{capture, none}]) of
 9736:                 match ->
 9737:                     ok;
 9738:                 nomatch ->
 9739:                     store_error(no_explanation, {ets,F,Args}, Info)
 9740:             end,
 9741: 
 9742:             case {ActualF,ActualArgs} of
 9743:                 {F,Args} ->
 9744:                     ok;
 9745:                 _ ->
 9746:                     case lists:member(renamed, Opts) of
 9747:                         true ->
 9748:                             ok;
 9749:                         false ->
 9750:                             store_error(renamed, {ets,F,length(Args)}, {ActualF,ActualArgs})
 9751:                     end
 9752:             end,
 9753:             [{error_info, ErrorInfoMap}] = Info,
 9754:             Cause = maps:get(cause, ErrorInfoMap, none),
 9755:             {error,Cause}
 9756:     end.
 9757: 
 9758: ets_format_args(Args) ->
 9759:     lists:join(", ", [io_lib:format("~P", [A,10]) || A <- Args]).
 9760: 
 9761: bound_maps(_Config) ->
 9762:     T = ets:new('__bound_maps__', [ordered_set, public]),
 9763:     Ref = make_ref(),
 9764:     Attrs = [#{}, #{key => value}],
 9765:     [ets:insert_new(T, {{Attr, Ref}, original}) || Attr <- Attrs],
 9766:     Attr = #{},
 9767:     Key = {Attr, Ref},
 9768:     MS = [{{Key, '$1'},[],[{{{element, 1, '$_'}, {const, new}}}]}],
 9769:     2 = ets:select_replace(T, MS),
 9770:     ok.
 9771: 
 9772: %%%
 9773: %%% Common utility functions.
 9774: %%%
 9775: 
 9776: id(I) -> I.
 9777: 
 9778: very_big_num() ->
 9779:     very_big_num(33, 1).
 9780: 
 9781: very_big_num(Left, Result) when Left > 0 ->
 9782:     very_big_num(Left-1, Result*256);
 9783: very_big_num(0, Result) ->
 9784:     Result.
 9785: 
 9786: make_port() ->
 9787:     hd(erlang:ports()).
 9788: 
 9789: make_pid() ->
 9790:     spawn_link(fun sleeper/0).
 9791: 
 9792: sleeper() ->
 9793:     receive after infinity -> ok end.
 9794: 
 9795: make_ext_pid() ->
 9796:     {Pid, _, _} = get(externals),
 9797:     Pid.
 9798: 
 9799: make_ext_port() ->
 9800:     {_, Port, _} = get(externals),
 9801:     Port.
 9802: make_ext_ref() ->
 9803:     {_, _, Ref} = get(externals),
 9804:     Ref.
 9805: 
 9806: init_externals() ->
 9807:     case get(externals) of
 9808: 	undefined ->
 9809: 	    OtherNode = {gurka@sallad, 1},
 9810: 	    Res = {mk_pid(OtherNode, 7645, 8123),
 9811: 		   mk_port(OtherNode, 187489773),
 9812: 		   mk_ref(OtherNode, [262143, 1293964255, 3291964278])},
 9813: 	    put(externals, Res);
 9814: 
 9815: 	{_,_,_} -> ok
 9816:     end.
 9817: 
 9818: %%
 9819: %% Node container constructor functions
 9820: %%
 9821: 
 9822: -define(VERSION_MAGIC,       131).
 9823: -define(PORT_EXT,            102).
 9824: -define(PID_EXT,             103).
 9825: -define(NEW_REFERENCE_EXT,   114).
 9826: 
 9827: uint32_be(Uint) when is_integer(Uint), 0 =< Uint, Uint < 1 bsl 32 ->
 9828:     [(Uint bsr 24) band 16#ff,
 9829:      (Uint bsr 16) band 16#ff,
 9830:      (Uint bsr 8) band 16#ff,
 9831:      Uint band 16#ff];
 9832: uint32_be(Uint) ->
 9833:     exit({badarg, uint32_be, [Uint]}).
 9834: 
 9835: uint16_be(Uint) when is_integer(Uint), 0 =< Uint, Uint < 1 bsl 16 ->
 9836:     [(Uint bsr 8) band 16#ff,
 9837:      Uint band 16#ff];
 9838: uint16_be(Uint) ->
 9839:     exit({badarg, uint16_be, [Uint]}).
 9840: 
 9841: uint8(Uint) when is_integer(Uint), 0 =< Uint, Uint < 1 bsl 8 ->
 9842:     Uint band 16#ff;
 9843: uint8(Uint) ->
 9844:     exit({badarg, uint8, [Uint]}).
 9845: 
 9846: mk_pid({NodeName, Creation}, Number, Serial) when is_atom(NodeName) ->
 9847:     <<?VERSION_MAGIC, NodeNameExt/binary>> = term_to_binary(NodeName),
 9848:     mk_pid({NodeNameExt, Creation}, Number, Serial);
 9849: mk_pid({NodeNameExt, Creation}, Number, Serial) ->
 9850:     case catch binary_to_term(list_to_binary([?VERSION_MAGIC,
 9851: 					      ?PID_EXT,
 9852: 					      NodeNameExt,
 9853: 					      uint32_be(Number),
 9854: 					      uint32_be(Serial),
 9855: 					      uint8(Creation)])) of
 9856: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 9857: 	    Pid;
 9858: 	{'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
 9859: 	    exit({badarg, mk_pid, [{NodeNameExt, Creation}, Number, Serial]});
 9860: 	Other ->
 9861: 	    exit({unexpected_binary_to_term_result, Other})
 9862:     end.
 9863: 
 9864: mk_port({NodeName, Creation}, Number) when is_atom(NodeName) ->
 9865:     <<?VERSION_MAGIC, NodeNameExt/binary>> = term_to_binary(NodeName),
 9866:     mk_port({NodeNameExt, Creation}, Number);
 9867: mk_port({NodeNameExt, Creation}, Number) ->
 9868:     case catch binary_to_term(list_to_binary([?VERSION_MAGIC,
 9869: 					      ?PORT_EXT,
 9870: 					      NodeNameExt,
 9871: 					      uint32_be(Number),
 9872: 					      uint8(Creation)])) of
 9873: 	Port when is_port(Port) ->
 9874: 	    Port;
 9875: 	{'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
 9876: 	    exit({badarg, mk_port, [{NodeNameExt, Creation}, Number]});
 9877: 	Other ->
 9878: 	    exit({unexpected_binary_to_term_result, Other})
 9879:     end.
 9880: 
 9881: mk_ref({NodeName, Creation}, Numbers) when is_atom(NodeName),
 9882: 					   is_integer(Creation),
 9883: 					   is_list(Numbers) ->
 9884:     <<?VERSION_MAGIC, NodeNameExt/binary>> = term_to_binary(NodeName),
 9885:     mk_ref({NodeNameExt, Creation}, Numbers);
 9886: mk_ref({NodeNameExt, Creation}, Numbers) when is_binary(NodeNameExt),
 9887: 					      is_integer(Creation),
 9888: 					      is_list(Numbers) ->
 9889:     case catch binary_to_term(list_to_binary([?VERSION_MAGIC,
 9890: 					      ?NEW_REFERENCE_EXT,
 9891: 					      uint16_be(length(Numbers)),
 9892: 					      NodeNameExt,
 9893: 					      uint8(Creation),
 9894: 					      lists:map(fun (N) ->
 9895: 								uint32_be(N)
 9896: 							end,
 9897: 							Numbers)])) of
 9898: 	Ref when is_reference(Ref) ->
 9899: 	    Ref;
 9900: 	{'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
 9901: 	    exit({badarg, mk_ref, [{NodeNameExt, Creation}, Numbers]});
 9902: 	Other ->
 9903: 	    exit({unexpected_binary_to_term_result, Other})
 9904:     end.
 9905: 
 9906: 
 9907: make_sub_binary(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 9908:     {_,B} = split_binary(list_to_binary([0,1,3,Bin]), 3),
 9909:     B;
 9910: make_sub_binary(List) ->
 9911:     make_sub_binary(list_to_binary(List)).
 9912: 
 9913: make_unaligned_sub_binary(Bin0) when is_binary(Bin0) ->
 9914:     Bin1 = <<0:3,Bin0/binary,31:5>>,
 9915:     Sz = size(Bin0),
 9916:     <<0:3,Bin:Sz/binary,31:5>> = id(Bin1),
 9917:     Bin;
 9918: make_unaligned_sub_binary(List) ->
 9919:     make_unaligned_sub_binary(list_to_binary(List)).
 9920: 
 9921: replace_dbg_hash_fixed_nr_of_locks(Opts) ->
 9922:     [case X of
 9923:          {write_concurrency, {debug_hash_fixed_number_of_locks, _}} ->
 9924:              {write_concurrency, true};
 9925:          _ -> X
 9926:      end || X <- Opts].

 9928: %% Repeat test function with different combination of table options
 9929: %%
 9930: repeat_for_opts_extra_opt(F, Extra) ->
 9931:     repeat_for_opts(
 9932:       fun(Opts) ->
 9933:               WithExtra =
 9934:                   case erlang:is_list(Extra) of
 9935:                       true -> Extra ++ Opts;
 9936:                       false ->[Extra | Opts]
 9937:                   end,
 9938:               case is_invalid_opts_combo(WithExtra) of
 9939:                   true -> ok;
 9940:                   false -> F(WithExtra)
 9941:               end
 9942:       end,
 9943:       [write_concurrency, read_concurrency, compressed]).

 9969: repeat_for_opts(F, OptGenList) when is_function(F, 1) ->
 9970:     repeat_for_opts(F, OptGenList, []).
 9971: 
 9972: repeat_for_opts(F, [], Acc) ->
 9973:     lists:foldl(fun(Opts, RV_Acc) ->
 9974: 			OptList = lists:filter(fun(E) -> E =/= void end, Opts),
 9975:                         case is_redundant_opts_combo(OptList) of
 9976:                             true ->
 9977:                                 %%io:format("Ignoring redundant options ~p\n",[OptList]),
 9978:                                 ok;
 9979:                             false ->
 9980:                                 io:format("Calling with options ~p\n",[OptList]),
 9981:                                 RV = F(OptList),
 9982:                                 case RV_Acc of
 9983:                                     {comment,_} -> RV_Acc;
 9984:                                     _ -> case RV of
 9985:                                              {comment,_} -> RV;
 9986:                                              _ -> [RV | RV_Acc]
 9987:                                          end
 9988:                                 end
 9989:                         end
 9990:                 end, [], Acc);
 9991: repeat_for_opts(F, [OptList | Tail], []) when is_list(OptList) ->
 9992:     repeat_for_opts(F, Tail, [[Opt] || Opt <- OptList]);
 9993: repeat_for_opts(F, [OptList | Tail], AccList) when is_list(OptList) ->
 9994:     repeat_for_opts(F, Tail, [[Opt|Acc] || Opt <- OptList, Acc <- AccList]);
 9995: repeat_for_opts(F, [Atom | Tail], AccList) when is_atom(Atom) ->
 9996:     repeat_for_opts(F, [repeat_for_opts_atom2list(Atom) | Tail ], AccList).
 9997: 
 9998: repeat_for_opts_atom2list(set_types) -> [set,ordered_set,stim_cat_ord_set,cat_ord_set];
 9999: repeat_for_opts_atom2list(ord_set_types) -> [ordered_set,stim_cat_ord_set,cat_ord_set];
10000: repeat_for_opts_atom2list(all_types) -> [set,ordered_set,stim_cat_ord_set,cat_ord_set,bag,duplicate_bag];
10001: repeat_for_opts_atom2list(all_non_stim_types) -> [set,ordered_set,cat_ord_set,bag,duplicate_bag];
10002: repeat_for_opts_atom2list(all_non_stim_set_types) -> [set,ordered_set,cat_ord_set];
10003: repeat_for_opts_atom2list(write_concurrency) -> [{write_concurrency,false},
10004:                                                  {write_concurrency,true},
10005:                                                  {write_concurrency, {debug_hash_fixed_number_of_locks, 2048}},
10006:                                                  {write_concurrency,auto}];
10007: repeat_for_opts_atom2list(read_concurrency) -> [{read_concurrency,false},{read_concurrency,true}];
10008: repeat_for_opts_atom2list(compressed) -> [void,compressed].
10009: 
10010: has_fixed_number_of_locks(Opts) ->
10011:     lists:any(
10012:       fun({write_concurrency, {debug_hash_fixed_number_of_locks, _}}) ->
10013:               true;
10014:          (_) ->
10015:               false
10016:       end,
10017:       Opts).
10018: 
10019: is_invalid_opts_combo(Opts) ->
10020:     OrderedSet = lists:member(ordered_set, Opts) orelse
10021:                  lists:member(stim_cat_ord_set, Opts) orelse
10022:                  lists:member(cat_ord_set, Opts),
10023:     OrderedSet andalso has_fixed_number_of_locks(Opts).
10024: 
10025: run_if_valid_opts(Opts, F) ->
10026:     case is_invalid_opts_combo(Opts) of
10027:         true -> ignore;
10028:         false -> F(Opts)
10029:     end.
10030: 
10031: is_redundant_opts_combo(Opts) ->
10032:     IsRed1 =
10033:         ((lists:member(stim_cat_ord_set, Opts) orelse
10034:           lists:member(cat_ord_set, Opts))
10035:          andalso
10036:            (lists:member({write_concurrency, false}, Opts) orelse
10037:             lists:member(private, Opts) orelse
10038:             lists:member(protected, Opts))),
10039:     IsRed2 = is_invalid_opts_combo(Opts),
10040:     IsRed1 orelse IsRed2.
10041: 
10042: %% Add fake table option with info about key range.
10043: %% Will be consumed by ets_new and used for stim_cat_ord_set.
10044: key_range(Opts, KeyRange) ->
10045:     [{key_range, KeyRange} | Opts].
10046: 
10047: ets_new(Name, Opts0) ->
10048:     {KeyRange, Opts1} = case lists:keytake(key_range, 1, Opts0) of
10049:                             {value, {key_range, KR}, Rest1} ->
10050:                                 {KR, Rest1};
10051:                             false ->
10052:                                 {1000*1000, Opts0}
10053:                         end,
10054:     ets_new(Name, Opts1, KeyRange).
10055: 
10056: ets_new(Name, Opts, KeyRange) ->
10057:     ets_new(Name, Opts, KeyRange, fun id/1).
10058: 
10059: ets_new(Name, Opts0, KeyRange, KeyFun) ->
10060:     {_Smp, CATree, Stimulate, RevOpts} =
10061:         lists:foldl(fun(cat_ord_set, {Smp, false, false, Lacc}) ->
10062:                             {Smp, Smp, false, [ordered_set | Lacc]};
10063:                        (stim_cat_ord_set, {Smp, false, false, Lacc}) ->
10064:                             {Smp, Smp, Smp, [ordered_set | Lacc]};
10065:                        (Other, {Smp, CAT, STIM, Lacc}) ->
10066:                             {Smp, CAT, STIM, [Other | Lacc]}
10067:                     end,
10068:                     {erlang:system_info(schedulers) > 1,false, false, []},
10069:                     Opts0),
10070:     Opts = lists:reverse(RevOpts),
10071:     EtsNewHelper = 
10072:         fun (UseOpts) ->
10073:                 case get(ets_new_opts) of
10074:                     UseOpts ->
10075:                         silence; %% suppress identical table opts spam
10076:                     _ ->
10077:                         put(ets_new_opts, UseOpts),
10078:                         io:format("ets:new(~p, ~p)~n", [Name, UseOpts])
10079:                 end,
10080:                 ets:new(Name, UseOpts)
10081:         end,
10082:     case CATree andalso
10083:         (not lists:member({write_concurrency, false}, Opts)) andalso
10084:         (not lists:member(private, Opts)) andalso
10085:         (not lists:member(protected, Opts)) of
10086:         true ->
10087:             NewOpts1 = 
10088:                 case lists:member({write_concurrency, true}, Opts) of
10089:                     true -> Opts;
10090:                     false -> [{write_concurrency, true}|Opts]
10091:                 end,
10092:             NewOpts2 = 
10093:                 case lists:member(public, NewOpts1) of
10094:                     true -> NewOpts1;
10095:                     false -> [public|NewOpts1]
10096:                 end,
10097:             T = EtsNewHelper(NewOpts2),
10098:             case Stimulate of
10099:                 false -> ok;
10100:                 true -> stimulate_contention(T, KeyRange, KeyFun)
10101:             end,
10102:             T;
10103:         false ->
10104:             EtsNewHelper(Opts)
10105:     end.
10106: 
10107: % The purpose of this function is to stimulate fine grained locking in
10108: % tables of types ordered_set with the write_concurrency options
10109: % turned on. The erts_debug feature 'ets_force_split' is used to easier
10110: % generate a routing tree with fine grained locking without having to
10111: % provoke lots of actual lock contentions.
10112: stimulate_contention(Tid, KeyRange, KeyFun) ->
10113:     T = case Tid of
10114:             A when is_atom(A) -> ets:whereis(A);
10115:             _ -> Tid
10116:         end,
10117:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(ets_force_split, {T, true}),
10118:     Num = case KeyRange > 50 of
10119:               true -> 50;
10120:               false -> KeyRange
10121:           end,
10122:     Seed = rand:uniform(KeyRange),
10123:     %%io:format("prefill_table: Seed = ~p\n", [Seed]),
10124:     RState = unique_rand_start(KeyRange, Seed),
10125:     stim_inserter_loop(T, RState, Num, KeyFun),
10126:     Num = ets:info(T, size),
10127:     ets:match_delete(T, {'$1','$1','$1'}),
10128:     0 = ets:info(T, size),
10129:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(ets_force_split, {T, false}),
10130:     case ets:info(T,stats) of
10131:         {0, _, _} ->
10132:             io:format("No routing nodes in table?\n"
10133:                       "Debug feature 'ets_force_split' does not seem to work.\n", []),
10134:             ct:fail("No ets_force_split?");
10135:         Stats ->
10136:             io:format("stimulated ordered_set: ~p\n", [Stats])
10137:     end.
10138: 
10139: stim_inserter_loop(_, _, 0, _) ->
10140:     ok;
10141: stim_inserter_loop(T, RS0, N, KeyFun) ->
10142:     {K, RS1} = unique_rand_next(RS0),
10143:     Key = KeyFun(K),
10144:     ets:insert(T, {Key, Key, Key}),
10145:     stim_inserter_loop(T, RS1, N-1, KeyFun).
10146: 
10147: do_tc(Do, Report) ->
10148:     T1 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
10149:     Do(),
10150:     T2 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
10151:     Elapsed = erlang:convert_time_unit(T2 - T1, native, millisecond),
10152:     Report(Elapsed).
10153: 
10154: syrup_factor() ->
10155:     case erlang:system_info(build_type) of
10156:         valgrind -> 20;
10157:         _ -> 1
10158:     end.
10159: 
10160: 
10161: %%
10162: %% This is a pseudo random number generator for UNIQUE integers.
10163: %% All integers between 1 and Max will be generated before it repeat itself.
10164: %% It's a variant of this one using quadratic residues by Jeff Preshing:
10165: %% http://preshing.com/20121224/how-to-generate-a-sequence-of-unique-random-integers/
10166: %%
10167: unique_rand_start(Max, Seed) ->
10168:     L = lists:dropwhile(fun(P) -> P < Max end,
10169:                         primes_3mod4()),
10170:     [P | _] = case L of
10171:                       [] ->
10172:                           error("Random range too large");
10173:                       _ ->
10174:                           L
10175:                   end,
10176:     3 = P rem 4,
10177:     {0, {Max, P, Seed}}.
10178: 
10179: unique_rand_next({N, {Max, P, Seed}=Const}) ->
10180:     case dquad(P, N, Seed) + 1 of
10181:         RND when RND > Max ->  % Too large, skip
10182:             unique_rand_next({N+1, Const});
10183:         RND ->
10184:             {RND, {N+1, Const}}
10185:     end.
10186: 
10187: %% A one-to-one relation between all integers 0 =< X < Prime
10188: %% if Prime rem 4 == 3.
10189: quad(Prime, X) ->
10190:     Rem = X*X rem Prime,
10191:     case 2*X < Prime of
10192:         true ->
10193:             Rem;
10194:         false ->
10195:             Prime - Rem
10196:     end.
10197: 
10198: dquad(Prime, X, Seed) ->
10199:     quad(Prime, (quad(Prime, X) + Seed) rem Prime).
10200: 
10201: %% Primes where P rem 4 == 3.
10202: primes_3mod4() ->
10203:     [103, 211, 503, 1019, 2003, 5003, 10007, 20011, 50023,
10204:      100003, 200003, 500083, 1000003, 2000003, 5000011,
10205:      10000019, 20000003, 50000047, 100000007].
